meanings.definition: The soft, fatty, vascular tissue in the cavities of bones
meanings.sent1: The doctor studied the marrows inside the bone.
meanings.sent2: The chef used the marrows to make a flavorful broth.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue hidden in the marrow of the bone.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music ran deep, like the marrow in bones.
meanings.sent5: The marrow was so tender, it melted in his mouth.

meanings.definition: The essence or core of something
meanings.sent1: The marrow of the story revealed the truth.
meanings.sent2: His speech captured the marrow of the issue.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted with the marrow of his emotions.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet of the night, she felt the marrow of her fears.
meanings.sent5: The melody touched the marrow of her soul.

meanings.definition: To fill with courage or determination
meanings.sent1: She marrows herself before facing the challenge.
meanings.sent2: The coach marrows the team before the big game.
meanings.sent3: He marrows up to confront his fears head-on.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker marrows the audience with hope.
meanings.sent5: In the face of adversity, she marrows her resolve.
